item.title: Global Coronavirus Deaths Top 270,000 as Some Restrictions Loosen
item.description: California loosened its coronavirus-related restrictions, joining a dozen other states in easing shutdowns that have led to steep job losses. The U.S. death toll topped 77,000.

item.title: Brazilian States Expand Coronavirus Restrictions as Death Toll Mounts
item.description: Authorities in five Brazilian states are tightening restrictions on residents amid a steep increase in reported deaths from Covid-19, clashing with President Jair Bolsonaro’s efforts to reopen Brazil’s beleaguered economy.

item.title: Iranians Return to Friday Prayer Despite Surge in Coronavirus Cases
item.description: Iranians in nearly 200 towns offered Friday prayers in mosques for the first time in two months as authorities eased some restrictions to contain the coronavirus pandemic, raising concerns of a new wave of infections.

item.title: A Chaotic Gray Market Determines Who Gets Coronavirus Gear---and Who Doesn't
item.description: A look inside the channel providing equipment that front-line workers can’t get enough of—masks, gloves, gowns—reveals a messy network of legitimate vendors and traders, fly-by-night brokers and opportunists.

item.title: Pompeo, Taking Break From Coronavirus Hiatus, Will Visit Israel
item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo will travel to Jerusalem next week to meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and political rival Benny Gantz, the State Department said.

item.title: Death Certificates Point to Much Higher Coronavirus Toll in Mexico
item.description: A review by The Wall Street Journal and testimony from funeral-home workers and doctors suggest there are more coronavirus deaths than the official tally. Many patients aren’t being tested for the virus, even if they die.
